The eligibility is 60 years and older and must be a resident of Anaheim.  An appointment must be required for ride pick up. All vouchers must be purchased in advance to any of the locations. Monday- Friday
9:00 am- 4:00 pm

transit_268_description:
Tired of the daily grind? We have a bus route for you. RTA proudly offers a variety of CommuterLink Express routes with premium service to Riverside, Orange, San Diego and San Bernardino counties. Travel in comfort and style while others languish in traffic. All of RTA’s express buses come with free Wi-Fi, plush seats, overhead reading lights, luggage and bike racks, and USB charging ports. Need another reason to ride? Metrolink riders with valid train tickets ride free! You can also catch a free ride anytime if you are a City of Riverside employee or if your college participates in the U-Pass or Go-Pass programs.
Any person who meets RTA disability requirements, presents a valid Medicare card, or seniors age 60 or above are eligible for a discounted fare on all RTA fixed-route services. Medi-Cal cards will not be accepted. Customers must show appropriate ID each time they board a bus to receive the discounted fare.
paratransit_264_description:
OmniGo
OmniGo consists of three circulator service routes serving the communities of Chino Hills, Grand Terrace and Yucaipa. OmniGo service features 16-passenger vehicles and fixed route fares, enabling residents of these communities to have access to major area destinations, including middle-schools and high-schools, senior centers, and shopping centers. Frequency of the circulators ranges from 30 to 70 minutes and all the routes provide service on weekends.

Routes 308/309/310 in Yucaipa operate Monday-Friday 6:00am-9:00pm

Routes 308/309 operate on Saturday 7:00am-8:30pm and Sunday 8:00am-6:45pm

Route 325 in Grand Terrace operates from 5:15 am - 8:30 pm Monday - Friday; on Saturday from 7:15 am - 6:15 pm; and on Sunday from 8:30 am - 6:15 pm. 

Route 365 in Chino Hills operates from 5 am - 10 pm Monday - Friday; on Saturday from 6 am - 6:45 pm; and on Sunday from 6 am - 5:45 pm.

paratransit_318_description:
The City of Simi Valley offers individually scheduled transportation services for seniors age 65+ and disability related transportation for those with an Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) Certification.

CORONAVIRUS SPECIFIC STATUS UPDATE:

Service is continuing as normal.



ELIGIBILITY:
Disability-related transportation:
Services individuals with disabilities of any age with ADA certification.
(If you have a temporary or permanent, physical, mental, visual, cognitive, or other disability or limitation that would impact your ability to access a fixed route bus service, you may be eligible for ADA Certification. See the section at the bottom of this entry for more information for how to apply for ADA certification.)
Eligibility for Simi Valley Senior Transportation:
Individuals aged 65 and over qualify for Dial-A-Ride transportation as seniors. Seniors with a disability are welcome to apply for ADA certification, as ADA certified riders have priority if rides reach capacity.

SERVICE ANIMALS
Only certified service animals, or animals confined in an approved animal carrier, are allowed on ADA/DAR vehicles.

SERVICE AREA
All rides must 1) start and end in Simi Valley, 2) transfer to the Los Angeles ACCESS or fixed route bus system, or 3) transfer to VISTA bus service. Other trips between Simi Valley and other cities would use the ECTA Connect Dial-A-Ride service.



RESERVATIONS:.
Transportation service may be requested by calling Simi Valley Transit and speaking with Transit Dispatcher or leaving a voice message.
When speaking with the Transit Dispatcher, you will be asked for the following information:
•Name
•ADA certification number (if applicable)
•Date of planned trip
•Appointment time, pick-up and destination address
•Number of passengers
•Time of return pick-up
•If door-to-door service will be needed
•If rider will have any mobility aids with them (i.e. walker, wheelchair)
TRANSFERS:
Trips between Simi Valley and any of these cities are available through the East County Transit Alliance Connect InterCity service. Connect InterCity services are available to ADA-certified passengers and seniors age 65 or older.
•Thousand Oaks
•Moorpark
•Camarillo
•Unincorporated Ventura County
Transfer points:
TO LOS ANGELES:
Simi Valley Dial-a-Ride offers a transfer to the LA Access Dial-A-Ride system at the Chatsworth Metrolink station. It is best to book the trip from the Chatsworth transfer point to your destination in LA through LA Access first, then to book the initial leg of the trip from your starting point in Simi Valley to the transfer point. Simi Valley Transit will coordinate timing so the passenger is at the transfer point in time for the second leg of the trip.
TO VISTA BUS SERVICE:
Explain when the Simi Valley Transit ride is scheduled, that the timing needs to be coordinated with the VISTA bus schedule.

APPLICATION PROCESS:
Disability-related:
•Online application or contact Mobility Management Partners (MMP)
Senior-related:
•Contact Simi Valley Transit

DOCUMENTS REQUIRED:
•For disability-related eligibility: ADA card, which is issued upon completion of ADA application.
•For eligibility as a senior: Proof of age (65 and over)

FARES:
•Exact fare, cash only, is required on Simi Valley Transit's ADA/DAR service.
•ADA Certified and Senior passengers: $2.00 for each one-way trip.
•A Personal Care Attendant or companion/guest with passenger must pay a required fare of $2.00 for each one-way trip.
•No additional fee is charged for a Personal Care Attendant if an ADA eligible rider has ADA-certification that allows for a Personal Care Attendant. All riders are allowed to bring guest passenger/companion. The fee waiver applies only if ADA certification allows for PCA.

PHONES:
•Simi Valley Transit: 805-583-6464
•Connect InterCity: 805-375-5467

SERVICE OFFERED IN FOLLOWING LANGUAGES:
English and Spanish

*Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) Certification* 
WHAT IS ADA CERTIFICATION:The Americans with Disabilities Act is a federal law which prohibits discrimination based on disability in employment, public services, transportation, public accommodations, and telecommunications. The transportation section of the ADA requires that fixed route transportation systems must be accessible to those with disabilities. The law also provides for complementary paratransit service if the buses are not accessible or if your disability or condition prevents you from using fixed-route public transportation.
REQUIREMENTS FOR ADA CERTIFICATION: Individual must have a temporary or permanent disability that prevents the rider from using fixed route bus service. The disability may need to be verified by a healthcare professional. 
TO APPLY FOR ADA CERTIFICATION: Individuals seeking ADA certification can complete an application online at https://www.goventura.org/getting-around/ada-certification/ or call Mobility Management Partners (MMP) at 888-667-7001 to apply.   An in person assessment may be required once application is submitted.

transit_319_description:
Thousand Oaks Transit (TOT) operates five local bus routes serving Thousand Oaks.					
Provides safe, quality, environmentally responsible, and cost effective coordinated transportation					
services.

All buses are equipped to accommodate wheelchairs and three-wheel scooters that comply with ADA (Americans with Disabilities Act) guidelines.
If you have a permanent or temporary disability that can be verified by a health professional, but you do not have an ADA card, call 888-667-7001 or go to www.goventura.org/getting-around/ada-certification/ to apply. 

Fares:
Regular: $2.00
Adults over the age of 65, and those who have medicare or a qualifying disability: $0.50
Children under age 5: Free

Bus Service Hours: 
Monday to Friday: 6:00am-7:00pm
Saturday & Sunday: 8:00am-7:00pm

Transportation Center Lobby Hours: 
Monday to Friday: 5:45am-7:15pm
Saturday & Sunday: 8:00am-7:00pm

Call (805) 375-5473 or visit https://www.toaks.org/departments/public-works/transit for schedule information.
paratransit_204_description:
Agoura Hills Dial-a-Ride is a shared ride, curb to curb service based on advance reservation. 

Eligibility: This service provides transportation to residents of the City of Agoura Hills and select neighboring unincorporated areas. 

Reservations: Schedule rides by calling 818-707-2005. Reservations are suggested (at least 2 hours in advance), but are not required.  

Trip fare ranges from $1.50 to $3.00 based on distance traveled.
transportationagency_45_description: Victorville Medical Transportation provides curb to curb as well as door to door transportation services for ambulatory, wheelchair and gurney passengers. We primarily operate in Los Angeles, Orange, San Bernardino, Riverside and Kern Counties (City of Ridgecrest), 24 hours and 7 days a week. We transport clients from their homes or nursing homes to their ongoing medical treatments such as dialysis, chemotherapy, physical therapy, doctors’ appointments, or to anywhere their insurance companies authorize. This service requires a reservation in advance and requires a sign-up process before transportation is provided, please call 877-777-7153 for more information.
transportationagency_20_description: Provides the chance for seniors to develop new interests and create lasting friendships.
paratransit_309_description:
GO ACCESS is a curb-to-curb service for individuals over the age of 65 and individuals that are permanently or temporarily disabled. There are no limits on number of trips.


•Serves the cities of Ojai, Oxnard, Port Hueneme, Ventura, and unincorporated areas. Also provides transfer connections with the Camarillo, Thousand Oaks, and Santa Paula paratransit service.

•Riders can use ACCESS for any trip purpose to any destination within the Gold Coast Transit District (GCTD) Service Area.

•Riders are picked up/dropped off at their home or point of origin, usually at the curb.

•Riders reserve trips one day in advance.

•Same-day trips may be provided based on availability.

•All vehicles equipped with wheelchair lifts

•Personal care attendants may ride along to aid passengers.

CORONAVIRUS SPECIFIC STATUS UPDATE:

Service is continuing as normal, with vehicles being disinfected on a regular basis to ensure passenger safety. There are currently no limitations to where passenger can or cannot go to however it is highly recommended that the dispatcher knows during the time of reservation if trip will be medical related.


ELIGIBILITY

Services seniors age 65+ and individuals with disabilities of any age with ADA certification.   (If you have a temporary or permanent, physical, mental, visual, cognitive, or other disability or limitation that would impact your ability to access a fixed route bus service, you may be eligible for ADA Certification. See the section at the bottom of this entry for more information for how to apply for ADA certification.) 



SERVICE ANIMALS Service animals must be on a leash or harness at all time. Service animals may sit on the floor out of the aisle. Service animals under fifteen pounds may be held in the passengers lap, but may not block the aisle or occupy a separate seat.

APPLICATION PROCESS

Senior Transportation:

•Anyone 65 years of age or older may use service and no application or certification is required. However, the driver may request proof of age when boarding the vehicle.



Disability Related transportation:

•In order to qualify for Go Access, an Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) application must be completed. This application can be obtained through the Ventura County Transportation Commission (VCTC).

•Once application is complete and submitted to the ADA coordinator, the applicant will be contacted to determine what the next steps are in obtaining ADA certification.



FARES
•$3.00 per trip

DOCUMENTS REQUIRED
Disability Related Transportation:
•ADA Certification
Senior Transportation:
•Proof of age (65+)

RESERVATIONS:
•Must call one day in advance to make a reservation.
•When planning your trip, please note that your ride may be shared with others. The driver will usually pick up and drop off other people on the way to your destination so your travel time will be longer than it would be by private automobile or taxi.
•There is a 20 minute pick-up range where vehicle will arrive 20 minutes prior to pick-up time or 20 minutes after. (i.e. If a trip is scheduled for an 8:30am pick-up time, the driver may show up at 8:20am or 8:40am).

PHONES:
•Questions and more information: 805-485-2319
•VCTC ADA Application: 888-667-7001.
•Call Monday-Friday 8:00am-5:00pm

*Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) Certification* 
WHAT IS ADA CERTIFICATION:The Americans with Disabilities Act is a federal law which prohibits discrimination based on disability in employment, public services, transportation, public accommodations, and telecommunications. The transportation section of the ADA requires that fixed route transportation systems must be accessible to those with disabilities. The law also provides for complementary paratransit service if the buses are not accessible or if your disability or condition prevents you from using fixed-route public transportation.
REQUIREMENTS FOR ADA CERTIFICATION: Individual must have a temporary or permanent disability that prevents the rider from using fixed route bus service. The disability may need to be verified by a healthcare professional. 
TO APPLY FOR ADA CERTIFICATION: Individuals seeking ADA certification can complete an application online at https://www.goventura.org/getting-around/ada-certification/ or call Mobility Management Partners (MMP) at 888-667-7001 to apply.   An in person assessment may be required once application is submitted.

transit_317_description:
Simi Valley Transit (SVT) provides safe, low cost, transportation services for the traveling public.					
Fixed Route service connects with Los Angeles County's METRO in Chatsworth. Also connects 					
to communities within Ventura County with the Ventura County Transportation Commission routes.

Riders may pay in cash only for single trips when they board the bus. Drivers are unable to give change. Daily, monthly, and discounted bulk ride passes may be purchased at City Hall and at most middle and senior high schools. Only certified service animals, or animals confined in an approved animal carrier, are allowed on SVT vehicles. All SVT buses are equipped with bike racks.

Seniors age 65 and older and individuals with a disability may qualify for a reduced fare by visiting the following website for an application:
https://www.simivalley.org/departments/community-services/simi-valley-transit#FR

Fares: $1.50 for adults and students
$0.75 for Seniors age 65 and older or those who qualify for the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA).
paratransit_313_description:
[if geo-logic is expanded to Vta start and end:] Moorpark Dial-A-Ride trips MUST start and end in the city of Moorpark. Trips can facilitate trips to other areas by connecting riders to train and bus stations within Moorpark that travel to other areas. 

[ECTA statement]

Transportation service for Moorpark residents age 65 and older. 

ELIGIBILITY:
-Must be age 65 and older

APPLICATION PROCESS
-Must fill out an application which is available at City Hall, Moorpark Active Adult Center, calling Moorpark transit, or online by visiting https://www.moorparkca.gov/238/Specialized-Transportation.

DOCUMENTS REQUIRED:
-None (applicant self-certifies age on application)

FARES:
Travel within the city of Moorpark: $2.00

TRANSFERS:
[ECTA statement]

RESERVATIONS:
Once enrolled in the program, call at least two hours prior to needing the ride if there is no mobility device (i.e. wheelchair). Call at least a day in advance if rider will have a mobility device. When calling, let the dispatcher know that you are a Moorpark Dial-A-Rider. 

PHONE:
For questions, information, and applications: 805-517-6257
Reservations: 805-375-5467

SERVICE OFFERED IN FOLLOWING LANGUAGES:
English, Spanish

transit_35_description:
Amtrak trains accommodate most wheeled mobility devices in use today.

Dimensions: The device should not exceed 30 inches (76 centimeters) wide and 48 inches (122 centimeters) long, and should have a minimum of 2 inches (5 centimeters) of ground clearance.
Weight: The weight limit for an occupied wheeled mobility device is 600 lbs (273 kg).
Manual and battery powered: Amtrak permits both manually operated and battery powered wheeled mobility devices that meet these specifications.

Amtrak will provide assistance to passengers with a disability who use a wheeled mobility device in the following situations:
High Platforms: Amtrak will assist you across the gap between the platform and the train by using a bridge plate.
Low-Level Platforms: Amtrak will provide access to the train through the use of station-based mobile lifts.
Bi-Level Trains: Amtrak will provide a ramp or station-based mobile lift to provide access to the lower level of the train.

paratransit_7_description:
Special Mode Transportation program provides eligible when medically indicated and approved for travel to and from VA health care, or VA authorized non-VA health care.
* Special Mode Transport (SMT) - is defined as an ambulance, ambulette, air ambulance, wheelchair bound/wheelchair van, or another mode of transportation specially designed to transport a disabled person. This would not include a mode of transportation not specifically designed to transport disabled persons, such as a bus, subway, taxi, train, or airplane.
Approval Process
All SMT approvals begin with a Bene-Travel Consult submitted by the Primary Care Provider (PCP). Once the Bene-Travel Office reviews the consult, it will either be denied and returned to the PCP for further review or approved. Once approved, the Veteran will be contacted for further instructions on scheduling their transportation to medical appointments. Each consult will have an expiration date. It is incumbent on the Veteran to meet with their PCP to update their consult if required.
paratransit_41_description:

Qualified passengers include Seniors (65+), persons with disabilities and persons certified under the American Disabilities Act (ADA). Reservations required at least 24 hours before the desired service.

DAR service area is 3/4 of a mile on either side of an existing Beaumont Pass Transit fixed route during the time in which that route is in service.

Service" for up to (12) passengers and (2) wheelchair tie downs.
Mo-Van provides low cost intra‐city (non‐ADA) transportation

Medical appointments, and shopping at local stores. Mo-Van

to their inability to donate. The "Mo-Van” is available to
transport Monday through Friday; our operating hours are
from 8:15 a.m. to 4:45 p.m. Riders must make reservations a
day in advance. The reservation number is (833) 745-8454.

An aide assisting a handicapped passenger rides free of charge; however, the person requiring the aide must have the ID card that specifies the need for the aide service.
paratransit_169_description: Provides lunch to older adults in a congregate setting. Transportation to and from the center may be provided for qualifying residents. A reservation must be made one hour before the meals are distributed.
paratransit_37_description:
The Mo-Van is a paratransit bus providing "Curb to Curb
Service" for up to (12) passengers and (2) wheelchair tie downs.
Mo-Van provides low cost intra‐city (non‐ADA) transportation
to Moreno Valley’s residents who are 60+ years’ old and/or
disabled adults to Moreno Valley Senior Center, non-emergency
medical appointments, and shopping at local stores. Mo-Van
covers a 20-mile radius of Moreno Valley. The fare donation is
$1.00 for one-way trips and $2.50 for one-way trips outside of
the city limits of Moreno Valley, but no‐one is turned away due
to their inability to donate. The "Mo-Van” is available to
transport Monday through Friday; our operating hours are
from 8:15 a.m. to 4:45 p.m. Riders must make reservations a
day in advance. The reservation number is (833) 745-8454.
paratransit_95_description: Transportation to medical and dental appointments, exercise programs, outpatient services, lab testing, mental health appointments, rehabilitation and therapy, health education and prescription pick-ups. The eligiblity is 60 years and older. Call to schedule an appointment 5 days before the requested date.
paratransit_122_description: We desire to provide transportation to the disable and elderly to medical appointments and regular errands.
transportationagency_102_description: Our desire is to provide transportation to the disabled and elderly to medical appointments and regular errands.

Offers transportation services to older adults within the city of Seal Beach. 
A shuttle service to local shopping centers. A dial-a-ride program for any location within the city and three miles outside of the city for medical purposes. Call for more details for the application process.

9:00 am Pick Up 
3:00 pm Drop Off 
Monday, Wednesday, and Friday

paratransit_124_description: Offers health and recreational services to older adults including: Health and wellness education, public internet access,Social activities, and special events, Fitness room and activities. paratransit_126_description: Get About provides transportation for seniors aged 60+ and disabled residents of Claremont, La Verne, Pomona, and San Dimas. paratransit_100_description: Offers transportation services to older adults in the Tustin area to medical facilities, the senior center and shopping locations within 3 miles of the Tustin Senior Center. partneragency_103_description: 211 LA County (or 211 LA) is the hub for community members and community organizations looking for all types of health, human, and social services in Los Angeles County.Contacting 2-1-1 LA is free*, confidential, and accessible in 140 languages.
paratransit_119_description:
GoGo turns on demand transportation companies like Lyft into services that can be accessed and monitored without a smartphone.
Register for GoGo by clicking here or by calling 1 (855) 464-6872.
Step 2:
CALL 1 (855) 464-6872 and wait to hear: "Thanks for calling GoGo"
Step 3:
PRESS 1 to immediately request a Lyft or Uber to your home.
PRESS 2 to request a Lyft or Uber to where we dropped you off last.
PRESS 3, 4 or 5 to request a Lyft or Uber to a custom pick up location (once you're registered please give us a call to set these up).
PRESS 6 to request a Lyft or Uber with an operator. 
PRESS 0 to speak with an operator about scheduling requests in advance or anything else.

Assigned TNC drivers usually arrive within 15 minutes and can take you up to 100 miles in any direction (or commuter trips like San Diego to LA). 

Have questions? 
Call (855) 464-6872.

transportationagency_40_description: .Reach Out programs include the Interfaith Volunteer Caregiving Program and the Transportation Program. The Interfaith Volunteer Caregiving Program matches volunteers with elderly and disabled neighbors. Through 2005, our services helped seniors and disabled persons in Twentynine Palms only. As of January 2006, Reach Out decided it would expand to the entire Morongo Basin.

paratransit_128_description:
Offers health and recreational services to older adults including, health and wellness education, public internet access, social activities and special events, fitness room and activities. Transportation to the center may be available to qualifying San Clemente residents. The eligibility is 50 years and older. 

Seniors residing in San Clemente will be picked up from their homes in the morning between the hours of 8:00 a.m. and 9:30 a.m. and transported to the center. Seniors are provided a return trip from the senior center to their homes in San Clemente between the hours of 1:00 p.m. and 2:30 pm.

The eligibility is 50 years and older. Reservations are made through the Lakeview Senior Center.
paratransit_92_description: Provides lunch to older adults in a congregate setting. Transportation to the center may be provided to qualifying residents. The eligibility is 60 years and older. A reservation must be made by 10:00 am, one day before planning to attend the Meal Program.
paratransit_74_description:
disabilities. All residents must register through the La Habra Community Services Department. Appointments required two weeks in advance. Must be a La Habra resident. paratransit_146_description:
The program was developed to provide Seniors with access to non-emergency medical appointments including but not limited to dialysis, therapy, dentistry, prescription pick-ups, lab tests, x-rays, etc.

Service Criteria:
Complete a simple application and waiver form and return it via mail or fax to obtain your Indentification Number. 
Rides must be scheduled a minimum of 5 days in advance. Calling 5 days in advance does not guarantee an appointment.Same day appointments depend on availability.
paratransit_116_description:
Offers peer-to-peer support, information and referrals to veterans and active duty military in acquiring:
Student veteran work study opportunities
Physical fitness group
Support groups/events

Transportation

8:00 am-4:30 pm Monday-Friday 
Weekend appointments may be available
paratransit_138_description: Commerce Dial-a-Ride is a shared ride, curb to curb service based on advance reservation serving seniors (50+) and persons with disabilities who are residents of the City of Commerce. To request a ride, call 323-887-4480.  Trip requests are accepted a minimum of 24 hours and a maximum of 30 days in advance.  Same-day reservation may be honored based on availability.  Reservation can be made from 7:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m., Monday through Friday.
paratransit_136_description: Get About, offered by Pomona Valley Transportation Authority (PVTA) is a shared ride, door to door service based on advance reservation. paratransit_106_description: Provides transportation to older adults to and from their medical appointments, medical testing, therapy or health and mobility exercises, dental appointments and prescription pick-ups. paratransit_143_description: Glendora Dial-a-Ride is a shared ride, curb to curb service based on advance reservation serving seniors (55+) and persons with disabilities who are residents of the City of Glendora. paratransit_144_description: La Mirada Transit Service is a shared ride, curb to curb service based on advance reservation serving residents of the City of La Mirada. Full fare is $1.00 and a discount fare of $0.50 is available for seniors (62+), disabled, Medicare card holders, and children under five for a one-way trip.
paratransit_148_description: Manhattan Beach Dial-a-Ride is a shared ride, curb to curb service based on advance reservation serving seniors (55+) and persons with disabilities who are residents of the City of Manhattan Beach . Reservations can be made from 6:30 am to 5:30 pm Monday through Friday; and 8:00 am to 5:00 pm Saturday and Sunday.  Transportation outside city limits is only available for medical appointments.
paratransit_147_description: Manhattan Beach Medical Appointment Dial-a-Ride is a shared ride, curb to curb service based on advance reservation serving seniors (55+) and persons with disabilities who are residents of the City of Manhattan Beach . Call the Signal HIll Community Services Department at 562-989-7330 to receive information regarding applying for program. Members will be issued a ticket book of taxi vouchers which can be redeemed with Yellow Cab taxi service.  Members pay the actual charges registered on the cab meter by using the voucher coupons just like cash, NOT to exceed $15 per ride. Members shall pay the driver cash only for those fares exceeding $15. Mobility impaired residents may call 562-591-8753 to register for Dial-a-Lift Long Beach services.
paratransit_151_description: Lawndale Dial-a-Ride is a shared ride, curb to curb service based on advance reservation serving seniors (60+) and persons with disabilities who are residents of the City of Lawndale. paratransit_153_description: Norwalk Dial-a-Ride is a shared ride, curb to curb service based on advance reservation serving seniors (60+) and persons with disabilities who are residents of the City of Norwalk.. To request a ride, call  562-929-7512.

paratransit_155_description: Bellflower Dial-a-Ride is a shared ride, curb to curb service based on advance reservation. paratransit_160_description: San Gabriel Dial-a-Ride is a shared ride, curb to curb service based on advance reservation. paratransit_161_description: City of Bell Dial-a-Ride - General Purpose is a shared ride, curb to curb service based on advance reservation serving seniors (60+) and persons with disabilities who are residents of the City of Bell. paratransit_163_description: Mission City Transit Dial-a-Ride is a shared ride, curb to curb service based on advance reservation. The best time to make an appointment is between 7:30 am to 10:00 am and between 2:00 pm to 4:00 pm. Children 7 years of age or younger must be accompanied by a rider 12 years or older. Discounted fare for seniors (60+) and persons with disabilities is $0.50.

paratransit_164_description: Wilmington Jaycees Foundation Transportation Program is a shared ride, curb to curb service based on advance reservation. To apply for this service and receive additional information regarding reserving a ride, call 310-518-4533.
paratransit_141_description: Provides lunch to older adults in a congregate setting. Transportation to the center may be available to qualifying San Clemente residents.
paratransit_165_description: Compton Dial-a-Ride is a shared ride, curb to curb service based on advance reservation. This service provides transportation to seniors (55+) and persons with disabilities (21+) who are residents of the City of Compton. All passengers must be registered at the Dollarhide Neighborhood Senior Center located at 1108 North Oleander Avenue in the City of Compton. Verification of age and residency is required at time of registration. Persons with disabilities must show a Braille Institute I.D., Medicare Card or DMV Placard I.D. with photo to meet eligibility requirements.  To request a ride, call 310-537-4890 and speak to a dispatcher or leave a message on the 24 hour answering service.  Trips must be scheduled at least 24 hours in advance and can be reserved up to one week in advance. Same day service is subject to availability.
paratransit_166_description: Offers transportation to and from medical appointments for older adult Costa Mesa residents. Does not provide transportation for outpatient procedures or other surgical types of procedures. An application must be filed with the Costa Mesa Senior Center and must be a Costa Mesa resident.
paratransit_167_description: Offers a shuttle to and from the senior center and other locations around Costa Mesa for personal care, shopping and recreation excursions. An application must be filed with the Costa Mesa Senior Center and one must be a Costa Mesa resident.
paratransit_168_description: Long Beach Transit Dial-a-Lift is a shared ride, curb to curb service based on advance reservation. This service provides transportation to persons with disabilities (18+) who are permanently mobility impaired and unable to use the Long Beach bus system and are residents of the cities of Long Beach, Lakewood, or Signal Hill. Applicants must first be members of Access Services, the ADA service provider. Access Services may be reached at 800-827-0829. To apply for service, call Long Beach Transit at 562-591-8753, Monday through Friday, 8:00 am to 4:30 pm. Once a member, rides can be reserved by calling 562-435-0115 between the hours of 6:30 am and 5:00 pm, seven days a week and up to 7 days in advance of the trip.
paratransit_173_description: Offers health and recreational services to older adults including; mental and physical fitness activities, educational classes, brief legal consultation, social activities and special events, bereavement counseling support groups. No cost transportation to the community center.
paratransit_170_description: Montebello Dial-a-Taxi Program is a private ride, curb to curb service based on advance reservation. This service provides transportation to seniors (62+), Medicare card holders, and/or persons with disabilities who are residents of the City of Montebello.  To register call 323-558-1625 Monday through Friday, 8:00 am to 5:00 pm to request Passenger Eligibility form. Once a member, rides can be reserved by calling 323-558-1810.  Ride requests may be made 24 hours 7 days a week. Only same day appointments are available. Call at least 30 minutes prior to requested pick up time. If you use a wheelchair, advise the dispatcher that you need an accessible van (may take longer up to an hour for a wheelchair accessible vehicle).
paratransit_171_description: Monterey Park Dial-a-Ride is a shared ride, curb to curb service based on advance reservation. This service provides transportation to seniors (55+) and persons with disabilities  who are residents of the City of Monterey Park.  To register for service, residents must complete an application and provide proof of residency with photo driver's license or current ID.  Applications are available at the Langley Center: 400 W. Emerson Ave., Monterey Park CA 91754. For more information, contact Dial-a-Ride at 626-307-1396 from Monday to Friday, 8:00 am to 4:00 pm. Registered members can call 626-307-1395 to reserve a ride.  Medical appointments need to be made at least 5 days in advance and regular appointments need to be made at least 3 days in advance. Service provided on a first come, first served basis.
paratransit_172_description: Carson Dial-a-Ride is a private ride, curb to curb service based on advance reservation. This service provides transportation to seniors (60+),  and persons with disabilities who are residents of the City of Carson.  To register, call 835-0212 ext. 1489 for application information. Once a member, rides can be reserved by calling 877-435-6111.  Ride requests may be made 24 hours 7 days a week. In addition to $2.00 trip fee, rider must pay the difference if trip exceeds $20.00.
paratransit_174_description: Provides lunch to older adults in a congregate setting. Transportation to the center may be available to qualifying San Juan Capistrano residents. The eligibility is 60 years and older.
paratransit_175_description: El Segundo Dial-a-Ride is a shared ride, curb to curb service based on advance reservation. This service provides transportation to seniors and persons with disabilities who are residents of the City of El Segundo.  To register, call 310-524-2700 for application information. Once a member, rides can be reserved by calling dispatch at 310-524-2704.  Dispatch is available 8:00 am to 5:00 pm Monday through Friday; 9:00 am to 1:00 pm Saturday; and 11:00 am to 4:00 pm Sunday. Ride requests may be made up to two weeks in advance. Rides are free, but there is a $5 annual fee for the required parks and recs membership card.
paratransit_177_description: Culver City Dial-a-Ride is a shared ride, curb to curb service based on advance reservation. This service provides transportation to Culver City residents that have a physician-certified disability, which prevents the use of regular public transportation.  To register, call 310-253-6729 for application information. Once a member, rides can be reserved by calling dispatch at 310-253-6580.
paratransit_178_description: Temple City Dial-a-Ride is a shared ride, curb to curb service based on advance reservation. This service provides transportation to seniors (60+) and persons with disabilities  who are residents of the City of Temple City.  To register, call 626-285-2171, ext. 4515 for application information. Once a member, rides can be reserved by calling reservation center at 626- 286-2456. Reservation center is available 7:00 am to 8:00 pm Monday through Friday; 9:00 am to 7:00 pm Saturday; and 8:30 am to 6:30 pm Sunday.  Trips can be reserved up to 7 days in advance.
paratransit_180_description: South El Monte Paratransit Program is a shared ride, curb to curb service based on advance reservation. This service provides transportation to seniors (60+) and persons with disabilities  who are residents of the City of South El Monte.  To register, call 626-448-0131 for application information and to reserve rides. Trips must be scheduled at least 24 hours in advance.
paratransit_179_description: Alhambra Senior Ride is a shared ride, curb to curb service based on advance reservation. Once a member, rides can be reserved by calling reservation center at 626-289-7433. It is recommended to schedule trips at least 3 days in advance.
paratransit_182_description: Pasadena Dial-a-Ride is a shared ride, curb to curb service based on advance reservation. To register, call 626-744-4094 for application information.  Once membership card has been issued rides can be reserved by calling 626-791-7200 between 8:00 am and 5:00 pm. Trips can be scheduled up to five days in advance, and should be scheduled at least 24 hours prior to desired reservation time.
paratransit_183_description: Pico Rivera Dial-a-Van is a shared ride, curb to curb service based on advance reservation. paratransit_181_description: Sierra Madre Dial-a-Ride is a shared ride, curb to curb service based on advance reservation. Trips should be scheduled at least 48 hours in advance.
paratransit_184_description: Rosemead Dial-a-Ride is a shared ride, curb to curb service based on advance reservation. Trips can be scheduled up to two weeks in advance and must be reserved no later than 24 hours in advance.
paratransit_185_description: BurbankBus Senior and Disabled Transit is a shared ride, curb to curb service based on advance reservation. Registered members may call 818-238-5360 between 8:30 am and 2:00 pm, Monday through Friday to schedule an appointment. Trips must be reserved no later than 24 hours in advance.
paratransit_186_description: South Pasadena Dial-a-Ride is a shared ride, curb to curb service based on advance reservation. This service provides transportation to seniors (55+) and persons with disabilities who are residents of the City of South Pasadena. To register for service, call 626-403-7398 for application information. Registered members may call 626-403-7368 to schedule a ride. Trips should be reserved no later than 24 hours in advance.  Monthly scheduled trips are offered to: Target, Walmart, Santa Anita Mall, and Alhambra Costco. See website for schedule.
paratransit_191_description: Beverly Hills Dial-a-Ride is a shared ride, curb to curb service based on advance reservation. This service provides transportation to seniors (62+) and persons with disabilities who are residents of the City of Beverly Hills. To register for service, call 310-285-6842 for application information. Registered members may call 310-275-2791 to schedule a ride. Service offers  transportation to certain areas adjacent to the City for medical appointments only.
paratransit_193_description: Lakewood DASH is a shared ride, curb to curb service based on advance reservation. This service provides transportation to seniors (60+) and persons with disabilities (18+) who are residents of the City of Lakewood. To register for service, call 562-924-0149 for application information.
paratransit_194_description: Azusa Dial-a-Ride is a shared ride, curb to curb service based on advance reservation. This service provides transportation to seniors (55+) and persons with disabilities who are residents of the City of Azusa. To register for service, call 626-812-5206 for application information.  Reservations should be made at least 3 days in advance.

paratransit_232_description:
VVTA Regional Vanpool Program allows groups of seven or more to commute for as low as $35 a week. Vanpool is convenient, comfortable, and saves money through a subsidy of up to $400 per month. PROGRAM ELIGIBILITY
VVTA Vanpool routes must begin or end within the greater Victor Valley and Barstow region
VVTA Vanpool applicant must be the vehicle leaseholder (primary driver or other passengers may not apply)
VVTA Vanpool must be used for commuting to and from work
Vehicles must be leased through VVTA Vanpool-approved leasing agencies
Vehicles must maintain at least 70% of vehicle seat occupancy
Vehicles must travel at least 30 miles round trip
Available seats must be available to the public
Vehicle leaseholder (applicant) and the primary driver must be volunteers and agree to all VVTA Vanpool terms and conditions
PROGRAM REQUIREMENTS
To maintain enrollment and qualify for the VVTA Vanpool Program subsidy, vanpools must comply with the following:

Promptly and accurately respond to VVTA Vanpool and leasing agent requests
Submit monthly vanpool reports through iVanpool.org
Update any changes to route, schedule, passenger, and location on iVanpool.org within five business days
Maintain minimum 70 percent vehicle occupancy
Adhere to VVTA Vanpool terms and conditions

paratransit_242_description:
Veterans Transportation Service (VTS) is a VA program designed to increase access to VA funded medical care through transportation. Unlike the travel eligibility requirements associated with transportation reimbursed through Beneficiary Travel, VTS has no eligibility requirements other than a Veteran needing transportation for medical treatment and a veriable VA medical appointment.

VTS operates as follows:

Office Hours: 5 a.m. to 9:30 p.m., Monday thru Friday
Reservations are required and scheduled based on need
Reserve your ride as soon as you make your medical appointment and no later than four business days prior
Your scheduled pick-up time may be considerably earlier than requested in order to accomodate other Veterans being served.
Vehicle operators must be able to park their vehicles in a safe location that does not block or impede traffic, allos the operator to maintain sight of vehicle at all times and has an accessible path of travel
What you need to know:

Other Veterans share the ride
Vehicles may travel in several directions during your trip and make stops to serve other Veterans
Travel time will vary based on trip distance, traffic conditions and other Veterans being served
Please be ready to leave at your scheduled pick-up time
Veterans are advised to bring sufficient medications and drinks/snacks as may be needed throughout the day
paratransit_243_description:
TREP is a mileage reimbursement transportation service that compliments public transportation. Volunteer drivers will transport seniors, people with disabilities, persons with low and limited income as well as other vulnerable residents to medical services, grocery shopping, banking and other important destinations. 

MBTA strives to continue to provide access and mobility for its residents of the Morongo Basin. The Transportation Reimbursement Escort Program (TREP) provides an incentive for volunteer drivers to assist eligible individuals who are unable to access public transportation or drive by providing necessary, escorted transportation. 
Participants receive funds to reimburse the volunteer driver and offset the costs associated with providing this transportation option. 

HOW DOES THE PROGRAM WORK?
•	If qualified, you must identify someone who is willing to be your driver (yes, you can have more than one driver). 
•	You keep track of your trips and miles driven to transport you
•	At the end of the month, you submit your records.
•	We reimburse you (as long as funding is available), and then you reimburse your driver(s).
•	We reimburse .25 cents per mile, for a maximum of 250 miles per month
Am I qualified?
The eligibility determination staff will determine whether or not you are qualified. You may be qualified if you: 

•	Are disabled, frail, or unable to drive
•	Are unable to use other forms of transportation (MBTA Services); and 
•	Live in San Bernardino County’s rural area within the Morongo Basin (including Johnson Valley, Pioneertown, Wonder Valley)

paratransit_253_description:
TRAVEL TRAINING
The Travel Training Program provides one-on-one or group assistance to seniors (age 62+) and individuals with disabilities on learning how to ride the Omnitrans bus system for the first time. The program is free to participate in, and is available to both seniors (age 62+) and individuals with disabilities who reside in the Omnitrans service area. The Travel Training Program gives participants the information and skills to ride the bus with confidence and take advantage of its benefits.  

WHAT WILL I LEARN?
Travel Training provides customized assistance based on the unique needs of each participant, allowing them to learn the skills needed to travel safely and comfortably on public transportation. During training, you will learn how to:
-Recognize routes, bus stops, and landmarks
-Use a bus book and plan a trip
-Get to and from bus stops safely
-Communicate with bus drivers
-Pay fares and buy passes
-Board, ride, and exit the bus safely
-Transfer to other buses
-Travel to various destinations throughout the community

WHERE CAN I TRAVEL TO?
Travel Trainers can show you how to travel to medical facilities, shopping malls, senior centers, school, work, or to visit family and friends. Your trainer will develop a training plan based on the destinations that you would like to travel to. 

HOW DO I SIGN UP?
Contact Special Transportation Services at (909) 379-7341 or ctsa@omnitrans.org to enroll in the program.
paratransit_254_description: If you are ready to experience the independence the bus offers and discover all the places VVTA can take you, we’ll send you a travel training welcome packet and walk you through the process. paratransit_54_description:
THE VOLUNTEER DRIVER PROGRAM (also known as the Transportation
Reimbursement Escort Program, or TREP) provides mileage reimbursement for individuals with disabilities that rely on others to drive them for transportation. 

Participants choose their own driver, which could include a family member, friend, neighbor, or caretaker. The reimbursement provided from the program offsets the cost associated with providing transportation, and can be used for trip purposes such as medical appointments, personal errands, visiting family and friends, or getting to work. 

HOW DOES IT WORK?
If qualified, you must identify someone who is willing to be your driver.
You keep track of the furthest destination that you travel to from your home each day. At the end of the month, your records for the furthest destination on day of travel are submitted via paper form or online.
Reimbursement funds are deposited into the rider’s bank account, and they reimburse their driver. All reimbursement funds are made by direct deposit; payments by check are not available. 

WHO IS ELIGIBLE?
Individuals with disabilities who reside in the East Valley cities of Colton, Fontana, Grand Terrace, Highland, Loma Linda, Redlands, Rialto, San Bernardino, and Yucaipa are eligible for the program. The program is for individuals who cannot use public transportation for some or all trips, and require the assistance of another individual for their transportation needs. 

The WEST VALLEY cities of Chino, Chino Hills, Montclair, Ontario, Rancho Cucamonga, and Upland are served by the Volunteer Driver Program operated by COMMUNITY SENIOR SERVICES. Individuals residing in the West Valley should contact Community Senior Services at (909) 621-9900 for more information on their program.

HOW DO I SIGN UP?
East Valley residents should contact Special Transportation Services at (909) 379-7341 or ctsa@omnitrans.org to request an application.          
West Valley residents should contact Community Senior Services at (909) 621-9900 for more information about their Volunteer Driver Program.

paratransit_231_description:
The Transportation Reimbursement for Individuals Program (TRIP) provides an incentive for volunteer drivers (usually friends or neighbors) to assist eligible individuals who are unable to drive or access public transportation by providing necessary, escorted transportation.   Participants receive funds to reimburse the volunteer driver and to offset the cost associated with providing transportation.

How does it work?
If qualified, you must identify someone who is willing to be your driver.  (You can have more than one driver.)
You keep track of your trips and miles driven to transport you.
At the end of the month, you submit your records.
We reimburse you (as long as funding is available), and then you reimburse your driver(s).
*Reimbursement payments will be made through direct deposit; the reimbursement amount will be automatically deposited into your bank account.  Paper checks will not be used.  In order to receive reimbursement payments, you MUST provide a bank account number. 
You may be qualified if you:
Are disabled, frail, or unable to drive;
Are unable to use other forms of transportation (such as buses)
Live in San Bernardino County’s rural, mountain, or desert communities
Those using TRIP cannot simultaneous use VVTA Direct Access service, which is complementary ADA paratransit service
transportationagency_227_description:
The City of Moorpark offers individually scheduled transportation services for seniors age 65+ and disability related transportation for those with an Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) Certification.

CORONAVIRUS SPECIFIC STATUS UPDATE:

Service is continuing, but fares are being waived at this time.



ELIGIBILITY:

Eligibility for Moorpark Senior Transportation:
Individuals aged 65 and over qualify for Dial-A-Ride transportation as seniors. Seniors with a disability are welcome to apply for ADA certification.

SERVICE ANIMALS
Service animals are allowed on vehicles.

SERVICE AREA:
All rides must 1) start and end in Moorpark, 2) transfer to the Los Angeles ACCESS or fixed route bus system, or 3) transfer to VISTA bus service. Other trips between Moorpark and other cities would use the ECTA Connect Dial-A-Ride service.



RESERVATIONS: Once enrolled in the program, call at least two hours prior to needing the ride if there is no mobility device (i.e. wheelchair). Call at least a day in advance if rider will have a mobility device. When calling, let the dispatcher know that you are a Moorpark Dial-A-Rider.

TRANSFERS:
In order to transfer outside of the City of Moorpark, passengers must go through the East County Transit Alliance (ECTA).
East County Transit Alliance (ECTA) services InterCity CONNECT Dial-A-Ride which is a shared ride transportation service available in most of eastern Ventura County and is specifically designed to permit travel outside local Dial-A-Ride service areas.
•Reservations can be made by calling ECTA, dispatcher will assist in organizing trip.
•Transfers to Los Angeles are available
•ECTA fares are $6.00

APPLICATION PROCESS:
•Contact Simi Valley Transit.

DOCUMENTS REQUIRED:

•Proof of age (65 and over).

FARES: Travel within the city of Moorpark: $2.00

PHONES:
•Questions/concerns about the Dial-A-Ride program: 805-517-6257
•Reservations/ECTA: 805-375-5467
•VCTC ADA Application: 888-667-7001

SERVICES OFFERED IN FOLLOWING LANGUAGES:
English, Spanish

*Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) Certification* 
WHAT IS ADA CERTIFICATION:The Americans with Disabilities Act is a federal law which prohibits discrimination based on disability in employment, public services, transportation, public accommodations, and telecommunications. The transportation section of the ADA requires that fixed route transportation systems must be accessible to those with disabilities. The law also provides for complementary paratransit service if the buses are not accessible or if your disability or condition prevents you from using fixed-route public transportation.
REQUIREMENTS FOR ADA CERTIFICATION: Individual must have a temporary or permanent disability that prevents the rider from using fixed route bus service. The disability may need to be verified by a healthcare professional. 
TO APPLY FOR ADA CERTIFICATION: Individuals seeking ADA certification can complete an application online at https://www.goventura.org/getting-around/ada-certification/ or call Mobility Management Partners (MMP) at 888-667-7001 to apply.   An in person assessment may be required once application is submitted.
paratransit_226_description:
It is recommended that you make advance reservations for Dial-a-Ride service – at least one day in advance, however, you can call up to one week ahead of time to schedule your trip. 

Dial-a-Ride works a bit different that an on-demand ride or Taxi service. Reservations must be made at least two (2) hours prior to your desired pickup time, so plan ahead!

Dial-a-Ride Vehicles can only provide service for pick up/ drop-offs which are accessible by maintained, paved roads. We cannot drive on dirt roads or pull onto wooden parking decks.

Dial-a-Ride drivers are not authorized to retrieve passengers from within their homes, doctors’ offices, restaurants, or etc.

Dial-a-Ride passengers must be able to get themselves to and from the DAR vehicle at the curb or bring an attendant with them. When you call for a reservation be ready to provide the following information:

Name and the number of riders
Pick up location and destination
Call back phone number

Let the dispatcher know if the pickup location is difficult to access if you (or the passenger) requires assistance, or if you must be at the
destination at a specific time.

Dial-a-Ride service is provided Monday through Sunday throughout
the RIM area including the communities of:
Cedar Pines, VOE, Crestline, Twin Peaks, Crest Park, Rimforest, Lake Arrowhead, Cedar Glen, Sky Forest, Running Springs, Arrowbear, Blue Jay..
Seniors (60+) and Persons with Disabilities 
Anyone who lives more than 3/4 mile from a Mountain Transit fixed-route stop, but within the Dial-a-Ride service area
Passengers must be able to get themselves to and from the vehicle at the curb or bring an attendant with them 
A Mountain Transit Disability ID Card allows persons with disabilities to ride all services at a reduced fare, and to use the Dial-a-Ride service

Download the Application for Disability Identification Card, or pick up a copy from our Crestline or Big Bear offices

paratransit_358_description:
Free, fixed-route shuttle bus transportation service that travels around neighborhood schools and residential areas near Kanan Road in Oak Park and Agoura Hills.
Services include transfers to Metro Route 161 and LADOT Commuter Express buses at the Thousand Oaks Blvd, Canwood Road, and Roadside Drive bus stops.

• Vehicles are accessible to people with disabilities
• Vehicles are equipped with bicycle racks (available on a first come, first available basis)
• For safety reasons bikes cannot be transported inside the buses

All Kanan Shuttle stops are marked by signs with a mountain lion logo. Check the map to find your stops and the schedule for route times. 
Call 805-375-5473 or visit https://www.toaks.org/departments/public-works/transit/kanan-shuttle for more information.
paratransit_312_description:
[match eligibility and accom., to TO]

Moorpark Disabled Paratransit service works just like the Senior Dial-A-Ride with some additional service. It is available to any person qualified with a disability regardless of age. 

ELIGIBILITY:
Anyone with ADA card can use the service. No residency requirement.
To qualify, one must first become certified under the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA). An application must be completed in order to enroll in the program which can be obtained by calling the City of Moorpark or the Ventura County Transportation Commission (VCTC).

Once application is completed, a representative of the Ventura County Transportation Commission will contact the applicant with more information for an assessment interview. 

Wheelchair accessible rides are available. If you are traveling with a wheelchair, please call at least a day in advance to book your ride.

DOCUMENTS REQUIRED:
-ADA certification card, which is issued upon completion of application and approval.

FARES:
-$2.00 each way for travel within Moorpark.

TRANSFERS:
[ECTA statement]

[match to senior notes]

paratransit_315_description:
This service is available to the general public and services Here2There within the Camarillo city limits. Reservations will not be taken for students to travel to and from school. Shopping bags are limited to three (3) bags per rider.



CORONAVIRUS SPECIFIC STATUS UPDATE:
Service is continuing as normal.

ELIGIBILITY for Camarillo disability-related transportation:
(If you have a temporary or permanent, physical, mental, visual, cognitive, or other disability or limitation that would impact your ability to access a fixed route bus service, you may be eligible for ADA Certification. See the section at the bottom of this entry for more information for how to apply for ADA certification.) 

SERVICE ANIMALS
Service animals are allowed on vehicle.

SERVICE AREA:
•Trips starting and ending within the City of Camarillo are available to the general public.
•Trips within the City of Camarillo and some nearby unincorporated areas are available to individuals with Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) certification and seniors (55+).
•No residency requirement

RESERVATIONS:

It is recommended to make reservations at least two days in advance of trip. Reservations made within 24 hours of trip are guaranteed (though timing may need to be negotiated). Same day reservations may be accepted two hours in advance of the trip depending on availability. Trips can be made two weeks in advance.


When making a reservation, please be prepared to provide the following information:
•Your name and telephone number.
•Your pick-up location.
•Your desired pick-up time.
•Your destination.
•What time you need to be at your destination.
•Your return time.
•If you need special assistance (walker, wheel chair, etc.)

TRANSFERS:

Transfers to neighboring paratransit services are available for riders 65 years and older and to individuals with a verifiable disability. This includes transfers to the East County Transit Alliance (ECTA) InterCity CONNECT Dial-A-Ride Service (serving eastern Ventura County, ECTA fare: $6.00) and to Gold Coast Go Access (serving western Ventura County, Gold Coast fare: $3.00).



APPLICATION PROCESS:
Call dispatch to reserve a ride. If passenger needs personal assistance, an Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) certification will be required in order to bring a personal care attendant.

DOCUMENTS REQUIRED
•Senior: Proof of age upon pick up.
•ADA: ADA certification to qualify for reduced fare or to travel to East Ventura County Cities

FARE:
•General purpose; Local fare (trip within Camarillo): $2.00
•Senior 55+/ADA: $1.50
PHONE:
-Reservations, questions, information: 805-988-4228

LANGUAGES:
English, Spanish

*Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) Certification* 
WHAT IS ADA CERTIFICATION:The Americans with Disabilities Act is a federal law which prohibits discrimination based on disability in employment, public services, transportation, public accommodations, and telecommunications. The transportation section of the ADA requires that fixed route transportation systems must be accessible to those with disabilities. The law also provides for complementary paratransit service if the buses are not accessible or if your disability or condition prevents you from using fixed-route public transportation.
REQUIREMENTS FOR ADA CERTIFICATION: Individual must have a temporary or permanent disability that prevents the rider from using fixed route bus service. The disability may need to be verified by a healthcare professional. 
TO APPLY FOR ADA CERTIFICATION: Individuals seeking ADA certification can complete an application online at https://www.goventura.org/getting-around/ada-certification/ or call Mobility Management Partners (MMP) at 888-667-7001 to apply.   An in person assessment may be required once application is submitted.
paratransit_361_description:
Offers an individually scheduled ride service that takes passengers from their origin to their destination.

CORONAVIRUS SPECIFIC STATUS UPDATE:

Service is continuing.

ELIGIBILITY

Valley Express Dial-A-Ride service is available to everyone. Passengers age 65+ or with Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) certification are given priority during the reservation process.


(If you have a temporary or permanent, physical, mental, visual, cognitive, or other disability or limitation that would impact your ability to access a fixed route bus service, you may be eligible for ADA Certification. See the section at the bottom of this entry for more information for how to apply for ADA certification.) 

SERVICE ANIMALS
Valley Express Bus and Dial-A-Ride allows service animals trained to assist people with disabilities.

SERVICE AREA
The service area includes the cities of Santa Paula and Fillmore and the unincorporated areas that make up Heritage Valley.

RESERVATIONS:

General public can only request a ride on the day of the desired ride. General public cannot schedule a ride in advance of the trip day. General public reservations are to be made at least two hours before desired trip time. Same-day reservations will be provided on a space-available basis only.


Seniors and ADA Paratransit Riders may reserve their ride up to one week in advance of their trip.
Subscription trips are available to the general public for trips that occur on the same time, on same days. This service is provided on a first come first serve basis and space is limited.

RESERVATION HOURS:
•Monday to Friday 5:45am-7:45pm
•Saturday and Sunday 8:00am-6:00pm

TRANSFERS:
General Public Transfers: within Fillmore/Piru OR within Santa Paula.
The following transfer points are available ONLY for seniors age 65+ and those who are ADA certified may also travel between the cities of:
•Fillmore
•Santa Paula
•Saticoy
Drop off and pickup locations for transferring are available surrounding the Wells Road Transfer Area. The boundary roads for transferring are:
•Saticoy Avenue and Los Angeles Avenue to the West
•Foothill Road and West Telegraph Road to the North
•North Wells Road, Date Avenue, Apple Avenue, Silk Tree Avenue, Heather Way, Lilac Way and Campanula Avenue to the East
•Darling Road, Aster Street and Rosal Lane to the South

APPLICATION PROCESS:
None, unless applying for ADA certification.

DOCUMENTS REQUIRED:
ADA Certification for those traveling between cities under ADA certification Proof of age for Senior ride.

FARES:
ADA riders: Personal Care Assistance rides for free.

PHONE:
•Reservations Line: 805-933-2267
•Information or comments on service: 800-438-1112

ASSISTANCE AVAILABLE IN FOLLOWING LANGUAGES:
English, Spanish

The law also provides for complementary paratransit service if the buses are not accessible or if your disability or condition prevents you from using fixed-route public transportation.
REQUIREMENTS FOR ADA CERTIFICATION: Individual must have a temporary or permanent disability that prevents the rider from using fixed route bus service. The disability may need to be verified by a healthcare professional.

paratransit_320_description:
The City of Thousand Oaks operates a door-to-door Dial-A-Ride program for passengers 65 years of age or older and for people with an Americans with Disabilities (ADA) card traveling within the cities of Thousand Oaks and Westlake Village.


CORONAVIRUS SPECIFIC STATUS UPDATE:

Service is continuing..


ELIGIBILITY:

This service is available to seniors (individuals aged 65 and over) and to individuals of any age with ADA certification.


(If you have a temporary or permanent, physical, mental, visual, cognitive, or other disability or limitation that would impact your ability to access a fixed route bus service, you may be eligible for ADA Certification. See the section at the bottom of this entry for more information for how to apply for ADA certification.) 


Seniors with a disability are welcome to apply for ADA certification, as ADA certified riders have priority if rides reach capacity.




SERVICE ANIMALS
Service animals are allowed on vehicles

SERVICE AREA:

DAR service is provided within the City of Thousand Oaks, Westlake Village, and the county’s unincorporated areas of Newbury Park,Oak Park, Ventu Park, Lynn Ranch, Rolling Oaks, Hidden Valley and Lake Sherwood.


TRANSFERS:

East County Transit Alliance (ECTA) services InterCity CONNECT Dial-A-Ride which is a shared ride transportation service available in most of eastern Ventura County and is specifically designed to permit travel outside local Dial-A-Ride service areas.


To Los Angeles: Thousand Oaks Dial-a-Ride offers a transfer to the LA Access Dial-A-Ride system at the Thousand Oaks Transit station. It is best to book the trip from the Thousand Oaks Transit Station to your destination in LA through LA Access first, then to book from your starting point in Thousand Oaks to the transit station. Thousand Oaks Transit will coordinate timing so the passenger is at the transfer point in time for the second part of the trip.


APPLICATION PROCESS:
•Disability-related - Online application or contact Mobility Management Partners.
•Senior-related – Contact Thousand Oaks Transit.

DOCUMENTS REQUIRED:
•For disability-related eligibility: ADA card, which is issued upon completion of ADA application
•For eligibility as a senior: Proof of age (65 and over)

FARES:
•General purpose; Local fare (trip within Thousand Oaks): $4.00
•Regional fare (ADA cardholders and seniors 55+ only): Camarillo to East Ventura County cities: $6.00

PHONE:

Reservations, Questions, Information/ECTA: 805-375-5467


SERVICE OFFERED IN FOLLOWING LANGUAGES:

English and Spanish

Provides public bus transportation to serve the diverse needs of the community. Reduced fares available to individuals with disabilities and to those over the age of 65 as well. paratransit_363_description:
The City of Moorpark offers individually scheduled transportation services for seniors age 65+ and disability related transportation for those with an Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) Certification.

CORONAVIRUS SPECIFIC STATUS UPDATE:

Service is continuing.



ELIGIBILITY:
Eligibility for Moorpark disability-related transportation:
Services individuals with disabilities of any age with ADA certification. (If you have a temporary or permanent, physical, mental, visual, cognitive, or other disability or limitation that would impact your ability to access a fixed route bus service, you may be eligible for ADA Certification. See the section at the bottom of this entry for more information for how to apply for ADA certification.)
Eligibility for Moorpark Senior Transportation:
Individuals aged 65 and over qualify for Dial-A-Ride transportation as seniors. Seniors with a disability are welcome to apply for ADA certification.

SERVICE ANIMALS
Service animals are allowed on vehicles.

SERVICE AREA:
All rides must 1) start and end in Moorpark, 2) transfer to the Los Angeles ACCESS or fixed route bus system, or 3) transfer to VISTA bus service. Other trips between Moorpark and other cities would use the ECTA Connect Dial-A-Ride service.



RESERVATIONS: Once enrolled in the program, call at least two hours prior to needing the ride if there is no mobility device (i.e. wheelchair). Call at least a day in advance if rider will have a mobility device. When calling, let the dispatcher know that you are a Moorpark Dial-A-Rider.

TRANSFERS:
In order to transfer outside of the City of Moorpark, passengers must go through the East County Transit Alliance (ECTA).
East County Transit Alliance (ECTA) services InterCity CONNECT Dial-A-Ride which is a shared ride transportation service available in most of eastern Ventura County and is specifically designed to permit travel outside local Dial-A-Ride service areas.
•Reservations can be made by calling ECTA, dispatcher will assist in organizing trip.
•Transfers to Los Angeles are available
•ECTA fares are $6.00

APPLICATION PROCESS:
•Disability-related – See below for more information on applying for ADA.
•Senior-related - Contact Simi Valley Transit.

DOCUMENTS REQUIRED:
•For disability-related eligibility: ADA card, which is issued upon completion of ADA application (See below for more information).
•For eligibility as a senior: Proof of age (65 and over).

FARES: Travel within the city of Moorpark: $2.00

PHONES:
•Questions/concerns about the Dial-A-Ride program: 805-517-6257
•Reservations/ECTA: 805-375-5467
•VCTC ADA Application: 888-667-7001

SERVICES OFFERED IN FOLLOWING LANGUAGES:
English, Spanish

*Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) Certification* 
WHAT IS ADA CERTIFICATION:The Americans with Disabilities Act is a federal law which prohibits discrimination based on disability in employment, public services, transportation, public accommodations, and telecommunications. The transportation section of the ADA requires that fixed route transportation systems must be accessible to those with disabilities. The law also provides for complementary paratransit service if the buses are not accessible or if your disability or condition prevents you from using fixed-route public transportation.
REQUIREMENTS FOR ADA CERTIFICATION: Individual must have a temporary or permanent disability that prevents the rider from using fixed route bus service. The disability may need to be verified by a healthcare professional. 
TO APPLY FOR ADA CERTIFICATION: Individuals seeking ADA certification can complete an application online at https://www.goventura.org/getting-around/ada-certification/ or call Mobility Management Partners (MMP) at 888-667-7001 to apply.   An in person assessment may be required once application is submitted.
paratransit_321_description:
ECTA CONNECT InterCity Dial-A-Ride is a shared ride transportation service available in most of eastern Ventura County that provides travel between local dial-a-ride service areas. ECTA service exists to complement, but not replace, local, city-specific paratransit services. For this reason, ECTA provides only intercity service, meaning trips must cross a city limit. Trips are not provided within the same city limit or between Thousand Oaks and Westlake Village (which are provided by local dial-a-ride services in each community).



CORONAVIRUS SPECIFIC STATUS UPDATE:

Service is continuing.



ELIGIBILITY

•Seniors age 65 and older

•Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) certified individuals



For ECTA Disability Related Transportation: If you have a temporary or permanent disability that would prevent you have using a fixed route bus service and which can be verified by a healthcare professional, you may be eligible for ADA Certification. See the section at the bottom of this entry for more information for how to apply for ADA certification.

SERVICE ANIMALS
Service animals are allowed on vehicles.

SERVICE AREA:

ECTA service is available to residents of the Cities of Moorpark, Simi Valley, Thousand Oaks, Westlake Village, and Ventura County unincorporated areas inside the city limits of these cities (referred to as Primary Service Area).



RESERVATIONS:
Reservations are required at least one day in advance of travel, and may be made up to two weeks in advance. Subscriptions for recurring trips may be requested (subject to capacity limits). Each reservation must be at least one hour apart.
Reservation Center Hours:
•Monday-Friday 5:30am-7:30pm
•Saturday-Sunday 7:30am-7:30pm
•On the day of your trip, please be ready 15 minutes prior to scheduled pick-up time. Drivers will wait a maximum of 5 minutes before departing even when they arrive up to 15 minutes early.

TRANSFERS: Trips to the Go Access area (via Camarillo access point) are arranged Monday-Saturday. Transfers to Los Angeles County via LA Access service area are available, but are only for ADA cardholders. Additional information during the reservation process will be required.

APPLICATION PROCESS:

•Call for trip reservations.

DOCUMENTS REQUIRED

•Proof of age (65+) or ADA (Americans with Disabilities) certification card

FARE:
•$6.00 each way
•Passengers may bring a companion, and full fare will be required as well. ADA cardholders may bring a Personal Care Assistant (PCA) at no additional charge.

PHONE

•Main Number: 805-375-5467 •Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) Inquiries: 888-667-7001

LANGUAGES

English and Spanish, translation services available for all other languages.

*Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) Certification*

WHAT IS ADA CERTIFICATION: The Americans with Disabilities Act is a federal law which prohibits discrimination based on disability in employment, public services, transportation, public accommodations, and telecommunications. The transportation section of the ADA requires that fixed route transportation systems must be accessible to those with disabilities. The law also provides for complementary paratransit service if the buses are not accessible or if your disability or condition prevents you from using fixed-route public transportation.

REQUIREMENTS FOR ADA CERTIFICATION: Individual must have a temporary or permanent disability that prevents the rider from using fixed route bus service. The disability must be verified by a healthcare professional.

TO APPLY FOR ADA CERTIFICATION:

Individuals seeking ADA certification can complete an application online at https://www.goventura.org/getting-around/ada-certification/ or call Mobility Management Partners (MMP) at 888-667-7001 to apply. An in person assessment must be done once application is submitted
paratransit_362_description:
Provides door-through-door transportation for non-emergency medical transport and for activities of daily living (including shopping, banking, etc) to residents of the Camarillo Health Care District residents.



Drivers are trained in CPR and First Aid, and have additional training in transporting frail, elderly cognitively-challenged and mobility-challenged riders. Vehicles are equipped with hydraulic lifts to accommodate wheelchair clients, oxygen canisters, and other assistive mobility devices. If you require wheelchair transport, a standard wheelchair can be provided during your ride. Vehicles are not equipped to carry electric wheelchairs, scooters, or other similarly heavy chairs.



CORONAVIRUS SPECIFIC STATUS UPDATE:
Service is continuing as normal; however there will be requirements before boarding on vehicle:
•Your temperature will be checked via contactless thermometer, by the driver, before you enter the vehicle. Your temperature reading must be less than 100 degrees farenheit to enter the vehicle.
•You will be asked if you are experiencing symptoms of COVID-19.
•You will be required to sign a waiver before transportation service is rendered.
•Social distancing requirements limit the number of passengers that may travel at one time. Please be prepared to sit where the driver instructs you to sit and remain in that seat until your ride is complete.
•The vehicle is appropriately sanitized after each ride.

ELIGIBILITY:
Care-A-Van is open to all residents age 18 and older.

SERVICE AREA:

Rides must start within District boundaries which includes the Greater Camarillo Area, Somis, and parts of the Las Posas and Santa Rosa Valleys. Destination anywhere in Ventura County. Fares will vary depending on the city passenger is traveling to:



RESERVATIONS:

It is strongly recommended to make a reservation at least 2-3 days in advance. Same day service may be possible based on availability. Trips outside operating hours may be accommodated under special circumstances.


•Credit card payment can be received by telephone for a convenient, cash-free ride.
•You will be asked to provide your name, telephone number, pick-up location, destination and what time you need to be there, if you need wheelchair assistance and what type of wheelchair

APPLICATION PROCESS:
No application required.

DOCUMENTS REQUIRED:
None.

FARES:
•Camarillo: $20 (one way)
•Oxnard: $25 (one way)
•Ventura: $30 (one way)
•Caregiver rides free

PHONES:
Main number: 805-388-2529

CAMARILLO HEALTHCARE DISTRICT OFFICE HOURS:
8:00am-4:30pm

oneclick.pages.contact_us.intro:
If we can be of assistance in navigating “Here2There”, we’re happy to help.

Please follow this link or email us at Here2There@lifespan-roch.org

If you have questions regarding a specific vendor or transportation service it should be brought directly to their attention.

We are always seeking additional transportation providers to add to Here2There. If you are a transportation provider or vendor and would like to know more, please contact us and be sure to include the best way to follow up:

How do I become a transportation provider? Email us at Here2There@lifespan-roch.org

transit_14_description:
RTS offers route service throughout Ontario County. 
Route Fares:
Adults    $1.00
Seniors 60+ $0.50
Persons with Disabilities  $0.50
Children under 5    FREE when accompanied by a fare-paying adult
Veterans    FREE with a Veterans Outreach Center issued bus pass
Value Passes Available from the Bus Operator

RTS Ontario wants to do more than get you
to your destination safely and on time. We
want to make your ride enjoyable too.
Call RTS for more information 585-394-2250
paratransit_68_description:
RTS offers Demand Response service for travel outside ¾ mile of route service curb to curb on a first come, first served basis, Monday through Friday from 7:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. To schedule a Demand Response ride call the RTS Ontario office Monday through Friday between 9:00 a.m. and 3:00 p.m. at least 48 hours in advance of your desired date of travel. When you call, we will inform you if your ride is within or between Zone 1 or 2.
RTS Ontario 585-394-2250
oneclick.pages.about_us.intro:
Here2There is a collaboration between, Livingston County, Monroe County, Ontario County and the lead agency, Lifespan of Rochester. Here2There would also have not been possible without the expertise of Genesee Regional Transportation Council and additional regional transportation partners.

The original tool was launched as Ride LivINgston to service the transportation needs of residents of Livingston County. Looking to this as an example for success, Here2There took shape as a collaboration in 2022 with a roll out in the summer of 2023.

Mission: The mission of Here2There is to provide information and choices for individuals to access the existing transportation system across the region. The tool serves to reduce barriers to ensure that all persons, including older adults, people with disabilities, individuals with limited income, and those with accessibility needs are met with access to a wide range of transportation solutions to ensure mobility in and around our region.

Goals: Two main goals of Here2There are to:

  1. Provide “1-click” mobility management to ensure easier and faster access to transportation information
  2. Increase the number of individuals using a wider variety of transportation services in the region.

If you would like to learn more about the individual partners, please take the time to explore all that they have to offer.
